info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued July 13 at 10:27PM EDT until July 14 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL FAILURE OF COLLEGE LAKE DAM ON THE BLACKWATER CREEK IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flash Flooding caused by a potential dam or levee failure is possible at the College Lake Dam. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties, Amherst and Campbell. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Dam failure may result in flash flooding of low-lying areas below the dam. Significant runoff may cause flooding of creeks and rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Numerous thunderstorms have dropped between 6 and 8 inches of rainfall this evening. Additional rainfall of up to 1 inch is possible. This amount of rainfall has caused College Lake levels to rise. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Dam safety experts with state and local emergency services are monitoring the dam and will issue a public statement as conditions warrant. PLAN NOW so you will know what to do in an emergency. Keep informed by listening to local radio and television for statements and possible warnings. Follow the advice of public safety officials.
